title: The forecast is that WTM Latin America 2016 will exceed the amount that was transacted this year in business in the travel industryTravelandtourworld.com
text:
WTM Latin America 2016 will exceed the figures of 2015
The trade show facilitated US$ 363 million in business agreements signed during and after the 2015 event
During its fourth edition, WTM Latin America, the event which brings the world to Latin America and promotes Latin America to the world, is forecasting that it will exceed the amount transacted in 2015 during the trade show that took place between 29 – 31 March in Expo Center Norte in São Paulo. This year, the event facilitated US$ 363 million in travel industry business, a figure that is 6.45% greater than in 2014 (US$ 341 million), which means that the trade show is growing year after year.
An independent survey carried out after this year’s event,between 22 – 24 April, indicated that 98% of the exhibitors considered WTM Latin America to be important for their business, while 95% said that it is constantly evolving to serve sector needs. The survey also revealed that 93% of the participants met quality professionals during the trade show.
Reifer de Souza Junior, Commercial Director of Maringá Turismo, made some great contacts during his first participation in WTM Latin America this year. “I can honestly say that this is a fundamental event for establishing new business deals and partnerships”, he said during the event.
Alexander Haim, Sales Manager of shipping line, Royal Caribbean, who has been taking part in the trade show since its first edition, said that being at WTM Latin America is always a positive experience. “I understand it as being an opportunity to establish relationships and identify opportunities and then we re-establish the contacts and do the business on subsequent days.”
The great amount of business that it is predicted will be done during WTM Latin America 2016 can be credited to the consolidation of the event, its central location and the numerous opportunities for networking that are available to participants.This year, the event grew by an impressive 37% in the number of travel buyers who were present, including the Hosted Buyers, all of whom were looking to do business in the various networking sessions and pre-scheduled meetings organized with the exhibitors.
Once again occupying a place of prominence in the exhibition pavilion, Braztoa will be holding its 45th Business Meeting and bringing together its associates, which are responsible for 90% of the travel packages sold in Brazil.
Lawrence Reinisch, Director of WTM Latin America, says: “WTM Latin America will continue offering incomparable business opportunities to exhibitors and buyers alike. We’re always working on new initiatives and, as a result,in 2016 we expect to exceed the US$ 363 million that were transacted in 2015.”
World Travel Market Latin America forms part of the WTM portfolio, which is owned by Reed Exhibitions and that resulted in almost US$ 7 billion in business in 2014. In addition to WTM Latin America, the other WTM events are the World Travel Market London, WTM Africa and the Arabian Travel Market, as well as the newcomers, WTM connect Asia and WTM connect China.
